responses.question_text: Do you have ISO 27001 certification?
responses.answer_text: Yes, RetailMax.com maintains ISO 27001:2013 certification covering our e-commerce platform, payment processing, and customer data management systems. Annual surveillance audits conducted by SGS with most recent recertification in June 2024.
responses.evidence: ISO 27001:2013 Certificate #RM-ISO-2024

responses.question_text: What is your SOC 2 compliance status?
responses.answer_text: RetailMax maintains SOC 2 Type II compliance with annual audits by PwC covering Security, Availability, and Confidentiality Trust Service Criteria. Our latest report covers the period January-December 2024.
responses.evidence: SOC 2 Type II Report FY2024 - PwC

responses.question_text: How do you handle GDPR compliance?
responses.answer_text: We maintain full GDPR compliance for EU customer data with appointed DPO, cookie consent management, data subject rights portal, privacy by design in all features, DPIA for marketing initiatives, and transparent privacy notices.
responses.evidence: GDPR E-Commerce Compliance Framework v3.2

responses.question_text: What encryption standards do you use?
responses.answer_text: RetailMax uses AES-256 encryption for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for all data in transit per PCI DSS requirements. Payment card data encrypted with tokenization. All cryptographic modules are FIPS 140-2 validated.
responses.evidence: Encryption Standards Policy - PCI DSS Compliant ESP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you support multi-factor authentication?
responses.answer_text: Yes, MFA is mandatory for all employee accounts and optional for customers (encouraged via incentives). Support for authenticator apps, SMS, email, and biometric authentication. Admin access requires hardware token MFA.
responses.evidence: Authentication Security Framework ASF-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data backup frequency?
responses.answer_text: Production databases backed up every hour with transaction log backups every 15 minutes. Customer data and order history retained for 7 years. Backups stored across three geographic regions with encryption.
responses.evidence: Backup & Recovery Procedures - E-Commerce BR-2024

responses.question_text: How often do you conduct penetration testing?
responses.answer_text: Quarterly external penetration tests per PCI DSS requirements by QSA-certified firm, annual application penetration testing for e-commerce platform, monthly vulnerability scans, and continuous security testing during development.
responses.evidence: Penetration Testing Report Q3-2024 - PCI DSS Compliant

responses.question_text: What is your incident response time?
responses.answer_text: 24/7 Security Operations Center with 10-minute initial response time for critical incidents (payment fraud, data breach), 30-minute response for high-severity incidents, and 2-hour response for medium-severity incidents.
responses.evidence: Incident Response SLA & Procedures IRP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a Business Continuity Plan?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our BCP ensures e-commerce platform availability during disruptions with RTO of 2 hours for shopping cart/checkout systems and RPO of 5 minutes for order data. BCP tested quarterly including holiday peak season scenarios.
responses.evidence: Business Continuity Plan - E-Commerce Operations BCP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data retention policy?
responses.answer_text: Customer account data retained while account is active plus 3 years. Transaction records retained for 7 years per tax/PCI DSS requirements. Marketing data retained per consent duration. GDPR right to erasure honored within 30 days.
responses.evidence: Data Retention & Disposal Policy DRD-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage access control?
responses.answer_text: Role-based access control with least privilege principles. Payment card data access restricted to authorized personnel only per PCI DSS. Quarterly access reviews, automatic account deactivation after 90 days inactivity, and segregation of duties.
responses.evidence: Access Control Policy - PCI DSS Requirement 7 & 8 ACP-2024

responses.question_text: What security training do employees receive?
responses.answer_text: Annual security awareness training mandatory for all employees covering phishing, social engineering, PCI DSS requirements, data protection, and fraud detection. Customer service receives additional payment security training.
responses.evidence: Security Awareness Training Program 2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a vulnerability management program?
responses.answer_text: Continuous vulnerability scanning per PCI DSS Requirement 11.2 with weekly authenticated scans. Critical vulnerabilities patched within 24 hours, high within 48 hours. Vulnerability metrics tracked and reported monthly.
responses.evidence: Vulnerability Management Program - PCI DSS Aligned VMP-2024

responses.question_text: What antivirus/endpoint protection do you use?
responses.answer_text: All endpoints deploy Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with real-time protection, behavioral analysis, ransomware protection, and automated threat response. Payment processing systems have additional anti-malware controls per PCI DSS.
responses.evidence: Endpoint Protection Standards - PCI DSS EPS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure your network?
responses.answer_text: Network security includes next-gen firewalls, IDS/IPS, DDoS protection via Cloudflare, network segmentation separating cardholder data environment per PCI DSS, DMZ for web servers, and wireless security with WPA3.
responses.evidence: Network Security Architecture - PCI DSS Requirement 1 NSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform background checks on employees?
responses.answer_text: All employees undergo background checks including criminal history, employment verification, and identity verification. Employees with payment card data access undergo enhanced screening per PCI DSS Requirement 12.7.
responses.evidence: Pre-Employment Screening Policy - PCI DSS PESP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your password policy?
responses.answer_text: Passwords require minimum 12 characters with complexity per PCI DSS Requirement 8.2. Password expiration every 90 days. Account lockout after 6 failed attempts. Passwords checked against breach databases.
responses.evidence: Password & Credential Management Policy PCMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure software development lifecycle?
responses.answer_text: Our SDLC includes security requirements gathering, threat modeling, secure coding standards (OWASP), SAST/DAST scanning, dependency scanning, penetration testing, and PCI DSS compliance validation before production release.
responses.evidence: Secure Development Lifecycle - E-Commerce SDL-v3.5

responses.question_text: How do you handle data breaches?
responses.answer_text: Data breach response includes immediate containment, forensic investigation, payment brand notification (Visa, Mastercard), PCI DSS breach notification to acquirer, customer notification per state breach laws, and regulatory reporting (GDPR, CCPA).
responses.evidence: Data Breach Response Plan - Payment Card & PII DBRP-2024

responses.question_text: What cloud providers do you use?
responses.answer_text: RetailMax operates on AWS with PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certification. Cardholder data environment hosted in PCI DSS-compliant AWS infrastructure. Multi-region deployment for high availability and disaster recovery.
responses.evidence: Cloud Infrastructure - PCI DSS Compliant AWS CIP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you encrypt data in transit?
responses.answer_text: All data in transit encrypted using TLS 1.3 per PCI DSS Requirement 4. Payment card data transmission uses additional encryption. HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) enforced. Legacy protocols disabled.
responses.evidence: Transport Layer Security Standards - PCI DSS TLS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage third-party vendor risk?
responses.answer_text: All service providers handling payment card data undergo PCI DSS compliance verification. Vendor security assessments annually, AOC/SAQ collection, security questionnaires, and monitoring. Critical vendors audited on-site.
responses.evidence: Third-Party Risk Management - PCI DSS Requirement 12.8 TPRM-2024

responses.question_text: What is your change management process?
responses.answer_text: Changes to production systems follow CAB approval with security impact analysis, testing in staging environment, PCI DSS compliance validation for CDE changes, rollback procedures, and post-implementation review.
responses.evidence: Change Management Procedures - PCI DSS CMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a DDoS mitigation strategy?
responses.answer_text: Yes, multi-layered DDoS protection via Cloudflare with automatic mitigation up to 500 Tbps ensures e-commerce availability. Rate limiting, bot management, and WAF protection. Separate mitigation plan for Black Friday/Cyber Monday traffic.
responses.evidence: DDoS Protection & High Traffic Mitigation Plan DPP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you monitor system logs?
responses.answer_text: Comprehensive logging per PCI DSS Requirement 10 with centralized log management in Splunk. Real-time alerting for security events, tamper-evident logs, 1-year retention, and daily log review for cardholder data access.
responses.evidence: Security Logging & Monitoring Policy - PCI DSS SLM-2024

responses.question_text: What is your disaster recovery plan?
responses.answer_text: Multi-region DR with active-active deployment for e-commerce platform. RTO of 1 hour for customer-facing systems, RPO of 5 minutes for order data. DR tested quarterly with Black Friday volume simulation.
responses.evidence: Disaster Recovery Plan - E-Commerce High Availability DRP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you segregate customer data?
responses.answer_text: Customer data logically segregated by region (US, EU, APAC) with separate databases per data residency requirements. Multi-tenant architecture ensures customer order isolation. Payment card data in isolated CDE per PCI DSS.
responses.evidence: Data Segregation Architecture - E-Commerce DSA-2024

responses.question_text: What database encryption do you use?
responses.answer_text: All databases use Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with AES-256. Payment card data tokenized via third-party tokenization service (PCI DSS Level 1). Encryption keys managed in AWS KMS with automatic rotation.
responses.evidence: Database Encryption - PCI DSS Requirement 3 DBE-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security patches?
responses.answer_text: Critical security patches applied within 24 hours per PCI DSS requirement for critical patches. High-severity within 48 hours. Monthly patch cycle for routine updates. Payment processing systems patched during maintenance windows.
responses.evidence: Patch Management Policy - PCI DSS Requirement 6.2 PMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have cyber insurance?
responses.answer_text: Yes, RetailMax maintains $30M cyber liability insurance covering payment card breach costs, business interruption, regulatory fines (PCI DSS, GDPR, state breach laws), forensic investigation, and customer notification.
responses.evidence: Cyber Insurance Policy #RM-CYB-2024

responses.question_text: What compliance frameworks do you follow?
responses.answer_text: We maintain compliance with PCI DSS v4.0 (Level 1 Merchant), SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, GDPR, CCPA, and state consumer privacy laws. Regular assessments by QSA for PCI DSS compliance.
responses.evidence: Compliance Framework Matrix - E-Commerce 2024

responses.question_text: How do you protect against ransomware?
responses.answer_text: Ransomware protection includes immutable backups, EDR with behavioral detection, email advanced threat protection, application whitelisting on critical systems, network segmentation, and quarterly ransomware tabletop exercises.
responses.evidence: Ransomware Defense Strategy - E-Commerce Continuity RDS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform code reviews?
responses.answer_text: All code requires peer review per PCI DSS Requirement 6.3.2. Payment processing code undergoes additional security-focused review. Code review includes OWASP Top 10 and PCI DSS secure coding standards validation.
responses.evidence: Secure Code Review Standards - PCI DSS SCRS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data classification policy?
responses.answer_text: Data classified as Public, Internal, Confidential, PCI (payment card data), and PII. Each classification has handling requirements. Automated DLP detects and protects payment card data and PII.
responses.evidence: Data Classification Policy - E-Commerce DCP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure API security?
responses.answer_text: APIs use OAuth 2.0 authentication, API gateway with rate limiting (per customer tier), input validation, OWASP API Top 10 protection, comprehensive logging, and WAF. Payment APIs are PCI DSS compliant.
responses.evidence: API Security Standards - PCI DSS Compliant ASS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a bug bounty program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, public bug bounty program via HackerOne with rewards up to $20,000 for critical vulnerabilities. Payment processing vulnerabilities have elevated rewards. 200+ vulnerabilities resolved through program since 2020.
responses.evidence: Bug Bounty Program - hackerone.com/retailmax

responses.question_text: What email security measures do you use?
responses.answer_text: Email security includes Proofpoint for advanced threat protection, SPF/DKIM/DMARC enforcement (DMARC at reject), phishing protection, attachment sandboxing, URL rewriting, and employee phishing simulations monthly.
responses.evidence: Email Security Policy - Anti-Phishing ESP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle cryptographic key management?
responses.answer_text: Cryptographic keys managed in AWS KMS and CloudHSM (FIPS 140-2 Level 3) per PCI DSS Requirement 3.6. Automatic key rotation every 90 days. Key access logged and monitored. Separate keys for different environments.
responses.evidence: Cryptographic Key Management - PCI DSS CKM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have physical security controls?
responses.answer_text: AWS data centers provide physical security meeting PCI DSS requirements. RetailMax offices have badge access, visitor escort, CCTV, and secure disposal for media. No payment card data stored at office locations.
responses.evidence: Physical Security Standards - PCI DSS Requirement 9 PSS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your mobile device security policy?
responses.answer_text: All mobile devices accessing corporate resources require MDM (Microsoft Intune), encryption, remote wipe, biometric authentication, and app-level protection. Mobile shopping app uses certificate pinning and tokenized payments.
responses.evidence: Mobile Device Management Policy - E-Commerce MDM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure container deployments?
responses.answer_text: Container security includes image signing and verification, vulnerability scanning via Aqua Security, runtime protection, secrets via AWS Secrets Manager, immutable infrastructure, and Kubernetes network policies. PCI DSS compliance validated.
responses.evidence: Container Security Framework - E-Commerce CSF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security incident escalation process?
responses.answer_text: Incidents categorized as Critical (payment fraud, data breach), High (security compromise), Medium (attempted breach), Low (policy violation). Payment card incidents escalate to CISO, legal, payment brands, and acquiring bank.
responses.evidence: Security Incident Escalation Matrix - PCI DSS SIEM-2024

responses.question_text: What data loss prevention measures do you have?
responses.answer_text: DLP deployed across email, endpoints, web, and cloud with policies preventing payment card data exfiltration (detecting PAN patterns), PII protection, and customer data monitoring. Violations trigger security investigation.
responses.evidence: Data Loss Prevention Program - Payment Card Protection DLP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure remote access?
responses.answer_text: Remote access requires VPN with MFA, device compliance checking (antivirus, encryption, patching), session monitoring, and activity logging per PCI DSS Requirement 8.3. No direct remote access to cardholder data environment.
responses.evidence: Remote Access Security Policy - PCI DSS RASP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security audit frequency?
responses.answer_text: Annual PCI DSS compliance assessment by QSA, annual SOC 2 audit, ISO 27001 surveillance audits, quarterly internal security audits, and quarterly PCI network scans by ASV. All findings tracked to remediation.
responses.evidence: Security Audit & Compliance Schedule 2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage privileged access?
responses.answer_text: Privileged access managed via CyberArk PAM per PCI DSS requirements with password vaulting, session recording, just-in-time access, dual authorization for production CDE access, and comprehensive audit logging.
responses.evidence: Privileged Access Management - PCI DSS Requirement 8 PAM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure code repository?
responses.answer_text: Code stored in GitHub Enterprise with branch protection, required code reviews, commit signing, secrets scanning (preventing PAN in code), Dependabot for dependency updates, and audit logging per PCI DSS.
responses.evidence: Source Code Management Security - PCI DSS SCM-2024

responses.question_text: What threat intelligence do you use?
responses.answer_text: E-commerce threat intelligence from Retail & Hospitality ISAC, payment brand fraud alerts, Recorded Future, and AlienVault OTX. Intelligence integrated into SIEM, WAF, and fraud detection systems for proactive defense.
responses.evidence: Threat Intelligence Program - E-Commerce & Payment Fraud TIP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security exceptions?
responses.answer_text: Security exceptions require risk assessment, compensating controls documentation per PCI DSS, CISO approval, time limitation (maximum 90 days), and tracking in GRC platform. PCI DSS exceptions reported to QSA during annual assessment.
responses.evidence: Security Exception Policy - PCI DSS Compliant SEP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform security metrics tracking?
responses.answer_text: Security KPIs include: PCI DSS compliance score, fraud losses, vulnerability closure rates, patch compliance, phishing click rates, security incidents, cart abandonment due to security concerns, and customer trust scores.
responses.evidence: Security Metrics Dashboard - E-Commerce 2024

responses.question_text: What is your data anonymization approach?
responses.answer_text: Production data in non-prod environments uses tokenization for payment card data, PII masking, synthetic customer generation, and data subset for testing. PCI DSS prohibits real card data in non-production environments.
responses.evidence: Data Anonymization Standards - PCI DSS Compliant DAS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure APIs at the network level?
responses.answer_text: APIs accessible via API gateway only with IP whitelisting for partners, geo-blocking for high-risk countries, rate limiting per merchant tier, DDoS protection, and WAF with PCI DSS rulesets.
responses.evidence: API Network Security Architecture - E-Commerce ANSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have asset inventory management?
responses.answer_text: Comprehensive asset inventory in ServiceNow CMDB per PCI DSS Requirement 2.4 including all systems in CDE. Automated discovery, quarterly reconciliation, unauthorized device quarantine, and EOL tracking.
responses.evidence: Asset Management & Inventory - PCI DSS AMI-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to secrets management?
responses.answer_text: Secrets stored in HashiCorp Vault with dynamic generation, automatic rotation, audit logging, and access policies. Payment gateway credentials rotated every 90 days. Hard-coded secrets prevented via pre-commit hooks.
responses.evidence: Secrets Management Policy - PCI DSS SMP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure supply chain security?
responses.answer_text: Supply chain security includes SBOM for all applications, dependency scanning via Snyk, vendor security assessments, package signature verification, and private npm/PyPI mirrors. Payment SDK updates verified before deployment.
responses.evidence: Software Supply Chain Security - E-Commerce SSCS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security champion program?
responses.answer_text: Security champions in each product team receive advanced training, participate in threat modeling, conduct security design reviews for new features, and serve as security liaisons. Champions receive quarterly PCI DSS training.
responses.evidence: Security Champion Program - E-Commerce v2.5

responses.question_text: What is your approach to zero trust?
responses.answer_text: Zero trust implementation includes identity-based access, continuous verification, micro-segmentation around payment processing systems, least privilege, device trust, and assume breach posture aligned with PCI DSS defense-in-depth.
responses.evidence: Zero Trust Architecture Roadmap - E-Commerce ZTA-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle secure deletion?
responses.answer_text: Secure deletion follows NIST SP 800-88 and PCI DSS Requirement 3.1. Payment card data deleted when no longer needed for business or legal requirements. Cryptographic erasure for encrypted data. Deletion verified and logged.
responses.evidence: Secure Data Disposal Procedures - PCI DSS SDDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security awareness for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executives receive quarterly security briefings covering e-commerce threats, payment fraud trends, PCI DSS compliance status, customer trust initiatives, and cyber risk to brand reputation. Annual board-level cyber risk workshop.
responses.evidence: Executive Security Education Program 2024

responses.question_text: What is your cloud security posture management?
responses.answer_text: Prisma Cloud monitors AWS infrastructure for PCI DSS compliance, CIS benchmark alignment, configuration drift detection, automated remediation for critical issues, and CDE boundary validation.
responses.evidence: Cloud Security Posture Management - PCI DSS CSPM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you perform security architecture reviews?
responses.answer_text: All new features undergo security architecture review including threat modeling (STRIDE), data flow analysis, PCI DSS scope impact assessment, authentication/authorization validation, and encryption requirements.
responses.evidence: Security Architecture Review Process - E-Commerce SARP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a red team program?
responses.answer_text: Annual red team exercises simulate attacks on e-commerce platform including payment fraud, credential stuffing, API abuse, web application attacks, and supply chain compromise. Results inform security roadmap.
responses.evidence: Red Team Exercise Report 2024 - E-Commerce Security

responses.question_text: What is your approach to database activity monitoring?
responses.answer_text: Imperva DAM monitors all database access per PCI DSS Requirement 10 with real-time alerting for payment card data access, privileged user monitoring, SQL injection prevention, and compliance reporting.
responses.evidence: Database Activity Monitoring - PCI DSS DAM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage security debt?
responses.answer_text: Security debt tracked in Jira with risk scoring, PCI DSS impact assessment, aging metrics, and quarterly CISO review. Critical security debt affecting payment processing prioritized above new features.
responses.evidence: Security Technical Debt Management Framework STDMF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have insider threat detection?
responses.answer_text: Insider threat detection includes UEBA monitoring payment card data access, after-hours CDE access alerts, bulk customer data download detection, fraud investigation integration, and HR coordination for at-risk employees.
responses.evidence: Insider Threat Detection Program - Payment Fraud ITDP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing coverage?
responses.answer_text: 100% SAST coverage for payment processing code per PCI DSS Requirement 6.3.2, quarterly application penetration testing, annual infrastructure pentest, continuous DAST for web applications, and monthly vulnerability scans.
responses.evidence: Security Testing Standards - PCI DSS STS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure compliance in CI/CD?
responses.answer_text: CI/CD pipelines include security gates per PCI DSS: SAST scanning, dependency checks, secrets detection, container scanning, PCI DSS compliance validation, and security approval for CDE deployments.
responses.evidence: Secure CI/CD Pipeline - PCI DSS SCDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure configuration baseline?
responses.answer_text: All systems follow CIS benchmarks and PCI DSS hardening guides per Requirement 2.2. Configuration compliance monitored via Qualys Policy Compliance. CDE systems have enhanced hardening. Deviations require exception approval.
responses.evidence: Secure Configuration Standards - PCI DSS SCS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to API versioning security?
responses.answer_text: API versions supported for 18 months after deprecation. Security patches backported to supported versions. Payment APIs have extended support due to merchant integration dependencies. Sunset requires 12-month merchant notice.
responses.evidence: API Lifecycle Management - E-Commerce ALM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for mergers and acquisitions?
responses.answer_text: M&A due diligence includes PCI DSS compliance verification, breach history review, payment processing security assessment, customer data handling evaluation, and 180-day security integration roadmap.
responses.evidence: M&A Security Due Diligence Playbook - E-Commerce v1.5

responses.question_text: Do you have security orchestration and automation?
responses.answer_text: Splunk Phantom SOAR automates fraud detection response, payment card compromise workflows, phishing investigation, threat enrichment, and incident case management. 70% of security alerts automated.
responses.evidence: Security Orchestration & Automation - Fraud Prevention SOAS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in DevOps?
responses.answer_text: DevSecOps includes security champions, PCI DSS requirements in user stories, automated security testing, shift-left security, infrastructure as code security, and security metrics in team dashboards.
responses.evidence: DevSecOps Implementation - E-Commerce Platform v2.0

responses.question_text: How do you manage security for SaaS applications?
responses.answer_text: SaaS apps require security assessment, SSO integration, data handling review, and Netskope CASB monitoring. Payment card data prohibited in SaaS apps unless PCI DSS Level 1 certified. Quarterly access reviews mandatory.
responses.evidence: SaaS Security Policy - Payment Data Protection SSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have network segmentation?
responses.answer_text: Network segmented per PCI DSS Requirement 1.3 with cardholder data environment isolated from rest of network. Separate zones for DMZ, web servers, application servers, databases, and management. Inter-zone firewalls required.
responses.evidence: Network Segmentation - PCI DSS Requirement 1 & 11.3 NSA-2024

responses.question_text: What is your certificate management process?
responses.answer_text: Certificates managed via Venafi with automated renewal 30 days before expiry per PCI DSS. Extended validation certificates for checkout pages. Certificate pinning for mobile app. Expired certificate = P1 incident.
responses.evidence: PKI & Certificate Management - E-Commerce PKI-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in machine learning models?
responses.answer_text: ML models for fraud detection and product recommendations undergo adversarial testing, bias testing, model validation, explainability requirements, privacy controls, and security review before production deployment.
responses.evidence: ML Security Framework - E-Commerce Fraud Detection MLSF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security governance framework?
responses.answer_text: Security governance includes quarterly board reporting, annual PCI DSS QSA assessment, CISO reporting to CEO, security steering committee, risk committee oversight, and defined escalation paths for payment incidents.
responses.evidence: Cybersecurity Governance Framework - E-Commerce 2024

responses.question_text: What is your data residency and sovereignty approach?
responses.answer_text: Customer data stored in regional data centers (US, EU, APAC) per data residency laws. Payment processing in-region per payment brand requirements. Cross-border data transfers use SCCs and adequacy decisions.
responses.evidence: Data Residency Policy - Global E-Commerce DRP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for IoT devices?
responses.answer_text: IoT devices (warehouse sensors, inventory trackers) on isolated VLAN, certificate authentication, encrypted communications, regular firmware updates, and monitoring. No payment card data accessible from IoT network.
responses.evidence: IoT Security Standards - Retail Operations IOSS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have quantum-safe cryptography plans?
responses.answer_text: Monitoring NIST post-quantum cryptography standards with assessment of impact on payment processing encryption. Crypto-agility built into architecture for algorithm migration. Roadmap for quantum-safe algorithms by 2027.
responses.evidence: Quantum Cryptography Readiness Plan QCRP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security incident lessons learned process?
responses.answer_text: All P0/P1 incidents undergo post-incident review within 5 days with root cause analysis, timeline, PCI DSS impact assessment, lessons learned, and remediation tracking. Payment fraud incidents analyzed for pattern detection.
responses.evidence: Post-Incident Review Process - E-Commerce PIR-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure software dependencies?
responses.answer_text: Dependencies scanned via Snyk and Dependabot with automated PRs for updates. Vulnerability monitoring for e-commerce frameworks, approved package lists, lock files required, and quarterly dependency security reviews.
responses.evidence: Software Dependency Security Management SDSM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security metrics for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executive dashboard: PCI DSS compliance score, fraud loss ratio, security incident trends, vulnerability metrics, customer trust scores, cart abandonment rates (security concerns), and competitive security benchmarking.
responses.evidence: Executive Security Dashboard - E-Commerce Q3-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in infrastructure as code?
responses.answer_text: IaC security includes Terraform/CloudFormation scanning via Checkov, PCI DSS compliance checks, policy as code, peer review required, immutable infrastructure for CDE, and GitOps with audit trails.
responses.evidence: Infrastructure as Code Security - PCI DSS IaCS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle data subject access requests?
responses.answer_text: DSAR managed via OneTrust platform with 30-day response per GDPR. Automated customer data discovery, data portability in JSON format, secure deletion with verification, and audit trail for compliance.
responses.evidence: DSAR & Customer Data Rights Management DCRM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements for contractors?
responses.answer_text: Contractors undergo background checks, HIPAA training if applicable, NDA signing, separate contractor accounts, PCI DSS training if CDE access needed, and immediate offboarding within 4 hours of contract end.
responses.evidence: Contractor Security Requirements - PCI DSS CSR-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing for APIs?
responses.answer_text: API testing includes OWASP API Top 10, authentication bypass testing, authorization testing, rate limiting validation, payment API PCI DSS compliance, business logic testing, and GraphQL security testing.
responses.evidence: API Security Testing Procedures - E-Commerce ASTP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in microservices?
responses.answer_text: Microservices include service mesh (Istio) for mTLS, API gateway authentication, distributed tracing for security events, secrets injection via Vault, network policies, and PCI DSS scope minimization per service.
responses.evidence: Microservices Security Architecture - E-Commerce MSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security research program?
responses.answer_text: Security research team collaborates with Retail & Hospitality ISAC, publishes e-commerce threat research, contributes to OWASP, and maintains relationships with payment brands for fraud trend sharing.
responses.evidence: Security Research & Industry Collaboration Program 2024

responses.question_text: What is your employee offboarding security process?
responses.answer_text: Offboarding includes immediate account deactivation, CDE access revocation within 30 minutes, device recovery, knowledge transfer, exit interview covering confidentiality, and 60-day monitoring for access attempts.
responses.evidence: Employee Offboarding Security Checklist - PCI DSS v3.0

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for remote workers?
responses.answer_text: Remote workers require company-managed laptops with EDR, VPN with MFA, no CDE access from home networks (VDI required), home office security guidance, and quarterly device compliance audits.
responses.evidence: Remote Work Security Policy - E-Commerce RWSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements in vendor contracts?
responses.answer_text: Vendor contracts include security schedules with encryption requirements, PCI DSS compliance for payment processors, breach notification within 24 hours, annual SOC 2 reports, audit rights, and indemnification clauses.
responses.evidence: Vendor Contract Security Requirements - PCI DSS Template

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for blockchain/distributed ledger?
responses.answer_text: We are piloting blockchain for supply chain transparency with security controls: permissioned blockchain, smart contract audits, node security hardening, key management in HSMs, and fraud detection integration.
responses.evidence: Blockchain Security Framework - Supply Chain Pilot BSF-2024

responses.question_text: How do you measure security culture?
responses.answer_text: Security culture measured via quarterly surveys, phishing simulation results (target <5% click rate), security training completion, fraud reporting rates, and customer security feedback scores.
responses.evidence: Security Culture Assessment - E-Commerce Q3-2024
